title: Higher Vehicle, Energy Imports Push January U.S. Trade Deficit to New Record
sub_head: U.S. imports rose while exports fell, leaving the trade deficit at $89.7 billion at the start of the year. Economists expect Russia-Ukraine crisis to disrupt trade this year.
body:
The U.S. trade deficit hit a fresh record in January ahead of the Russia-Ukraine crisis, as imports of vehicles and energy supplies increased while exports fell.
The foreign-trade gap in goods and services expanded 9.4% from the prior month to $89.7 billion in January, the Commerce Department said Tuesday.
